fullText:
The first Evita, Patti LuPone, was a force of nature. The latest Evita is a pretty cipher.

That assessment is not a slam on Solea Pfeiffer’s sly incarnation of Eva Perón. She wears the role with high-fashion hauteur in the new, insightful revival of Tim Rice and Andrew Lloyd Webber’s “Evita,” which opened Thursday at the New York City Center and continues through November 24.
rejectionReasoning: claude: This review is of an Evita revival at New York City Center, which is an off-Broadway venue, not a Broadway production; openai: The review is about a production at the New York City Center, not the current Broadway run.; kimi: The review covers a production at New York City Center (an Off-Broadway/Encores! venue), not a Broadway theater. The text explicitly states the show opened at New York City Center for a limited run through November 24.
